meanings.definition: The quality or ability of being suitable for drilling.
meanings.sent1: The drillability of the rock made it easy to create a tunnel.
meanings.sent2: The geologist assessed the drillability of the soil before starting the excavation.
meanings.sent3: The drillability of the cheese was so high that it crumbled effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The drillability of the material was like cutting through butter.
meanings.sent5: The contractor praised the drillability of the new equipment, making the job quick and efficient.

meanings.definition: The likelihood or ease of being drilled.
meanings.sent1: The drillability of the metal was low, causing the drill bit to break.
meanings.sent2: The engineer tested the drillability of the concrete to determine the best approach.
meanings.sent3: The drillability of the wall was so high that the drill went through in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The drillability of the surface was like drilling into a block of ice.
meanings.sent5: The drillability of the wood was excellent, allowing for smooth and precise drilling.
